byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Lynwood, and Adam Nagourney from Los Angeles. Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By IAN LOVETT and ADAM NAGOURNEY

abstract: Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department deputies who fatally shot Nicholas Robertson in front of gas station using 30 bullets, release video and photos of Robertson with gun; deputies say deceased fired it six times during altercation; community responds in outrage fueling contentious relationship between black community and police officers in area.
lead_paragraph: The Sheriff’s Office said deputies had fired 30 bullets at a man who shot a gun into the air several times and was a threat to officers and passers-by in Lynwood, Calif.

headline.main: Man Killed by Deputies in California Brandished Gun, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Man Killed by Deputies in California Brandished Gun, Officials Say

snippet: The Sheriff’s Office said deputies had fired 30 bullets at a man who shot a gun into the air several times and was a threat to officers and passers-by in Lynwood, Calif.
